Monster-ish Effect
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher DS Archive (DS): Monster Rancher DS: General QA: Monster-ish Effect
By Megadestroyer14 on Friday, August 13, 2010 - 06:15 pm:

Ok, i've found that if you take a monster, (let's use a Zan/Zan as our example) and mix it with some type of -ish monster (Zan-ish), by using the Zan/Zan's main type (top) and the -ish monster's sub type (bottom), it will make the special form of the breed (FakeGraffiti). I'm mainly confused because for monsters with multiple special types (Zans, bakus, etc) it will only make one of the special breeds. Anyone know if you can get the other special types of those monsters this way, or by drawing?

By Peter Halat on Friday, August 13, 2010 - 06:40 pm:

When you use an -ish monster in combining, it will
act like a pure breed. For example, an Abyss-ish in
combining will have a sub type of abyss.

By Shen the Keeper on Friday, August 13, 2010 - 07:10 pm:

Actually in another thread this has been tested..

It has been found if you use the subtype of a ??? monster, even though it shows up as a pure breed, it will create a special of whatever main breed you are using.

So in short, yes Mega, you're right.

And apparently there are a few specials that can only be gotten via some special spell manner.

By Thorr on Saturday, August 14, 2010 - 05:33 pm:

The other specials are the Zodiac monsters. You can only create them one way.

By OgreBattle on Sunday, August 15, 2010 - 06:16 pm:

And that is ... how? I'm still trying to figure out how to get the Killer General.
